citances.sentence: 11 The argument that that other purpose (that is the first purpose at paragraph [4] above) was not a "proper purpose" is not based on any view that a meeting of members is not competent to install new directors (see paragraph [7] above). That this is, in the abstract, a "proper purpose" for s 249Q purposes was explicitly recognised in Reefton Mining NL v Kimbriki Nominees Pty Ltd [2007] FCA 17 ; (2007) 61 ACSR 72. The argument that it was, in the particular context, not "proper" was advanced by reference to a number of factual matters to which it is now necessary to turn as a preliminary to considering the scope and effect of s 249Q of the Corporations Act .

[4] " FC Rules ". Applicant N v Respondent C [2007] FCA 1182 at para. 35 per Sundberg J (" Applicant N --- Appeal ") upholding the Judgment in this Court in Applicant N v Respondent C [2006] FMCA 1936 (" Applicant N "); and following ACCC v Amcor Printing Papers Group [2000] FCA 17 ; (2000) 169 ALR 344 at 356-357 per Sackville J; [2007] FCA 17 at para. 60 per Sackville J (" Amcor Printing "). See also Trade Practices Commission v George Weston Foods Ltd (No 2) [1980] FCA 16 ; (1980) 43 FLR 55 at 56-57 per Davies J (" George Weston Foods ").
